# 11.6.43 Error 46: Position limit error

# 11.6.43.1 Error 46-0 (emergency code 8612h)

Cause: Unknown position limit error

# Suggested steps:

- Switch off/on device. Please contact your service provider if this error occurs again
- Position was limited internally.
- Please check factor group setting and position command
- Take a scope record to determine if the position control overshoots.
- The speed control might run away, most likely due to a wrong encoder offset.
- Please check that the encoder offset is set properly.
- If auto commutation is used, re-view the auto commutation setting and test under all possible conditions.
- If torque mode is used, reduce torque, ensure external speed limitation, or increase speed control gain for stronger limitation.

# 11. Alarms & warnings

# 11.6.43.2 Error 46-1 (emergency code 8612h)

Cause: Negative software limit switch is exceeded (negative position limit)

Suggested steps:

- Quit error and change reference value
- Position was limited internally. Please check factor group setting and position command
- Take a scope record to determine if the position control overshoots.
- The speed control might run away, most likely due to a wrong encoder offset.
- Please check that the encoder offset is set properly.
- If auto commutation is used, re-view the auto commutation setting and test under all possible conditions.
- If torque mode is used, reduce torque, ensure external speed limitation, or increase speed control gain for stronger limitation.

- Take a scope record to determine if the position control overshoots.
- The speed control might run away, most likely due to a wrong encoder offset.
- Please check that the encoder offset is set properly.
- If auto commutation is used, re-view the auto commutation setting and test under all possible conditions.
- If torque mode is used, reduce torque, ensure external speed limitation, or increase speed control gain for stronger limitation.

- Please check factor group setting and position command
- Take a scope record to determine if the position control overshoots.

- Please check that the encoder offset is set properly.
- If auto commutation is used, re-view the auto commutation setting and test under all possible conditions.
Q: What are the suggested steps to resolve Error 46-0 (emergency code 8612h) as mentioned in the MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp 424?
A1: Switch off/on the device and contact your service provider if the error reoccurs.
A2: To resolve Error 46-0, ensure the position was not limited internally and check the factor group setting and position command.
A3: For Error 46-0, taking a scope record to check if the position control overshoots is recommended.
A4: Error 46-0 can be addressed by verifying the encoder offset is set properly and reviewing auto commutation settings if used.
A5: In case of Error 46-0, if torque mode is active, reducing torque or increasing speed control gain may help.

# 11.6.43 Error 46: Position limit error

# 11.6.43.1 Error 46-0 (emergency code 8612h)

Cause: Unknown position limit error

# Suggested steps:

- Switch off/on device. Please contact your service provider if this error occurs again
- Position was limited internally.
- Please check factor group setting and position command
- Take a scope record to determine if the position control overshoots.
- The speed control might run away, most likely due to a wrong encoder offset.
- Please check that the encoder offset is set properly.
- If auto commutation is used, re-view the auto commutation setting and test under all possible conditions.
- If torque mode is used, reduce torque, ensure external speed limitation, or increase speed control gain for stronger limitation.

Q: What is the significance of the encoder offset in resolving Error 46 as per the MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp 424?
A1: A properly set encoder offset is crucial to prevent the speed control from running away, a common cause of Error 46.
A2: The encoder offset's correct setting is vital to avoid Error 46 by ensuring accurate speed control.
A3: Error 46 often results from an incorrect encoder offset, making its proper configuration essential.

A5: The document highlights the importance of a correctly configured encoder offset in preventing Error 46.

Q: How does the MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp 424 suggest handling Error 46 when in torque mode?
A1: In torque mode, reducing torque or increasing speed control gain is suggested to handle Error 46.
A2: The document recommends ensuring external speed limitation or adjusting speed control gain for Error 46 in torque mode.
A3: For Error 46 during torque mode, lowering torque or enhancing speed control limitations is advised.
A4: Handling Error 46 in torque mode involves torque reduction and speed control adjustments.
A5: MSD ServoDrive suggests torque adjustments and speed control enhancements to address Error 46 in torque mode.
